item.title: Point72 为其 Star Trader 的发布下了有史以来最大的赌注
item.description: Point72 资产管理公司（Point72 Asset Management）的一位明星交易员即将离职，创办自己的对冲基金，并获得了该公司有史以来给予离职交易员的最大一笔初始资金支持。【原文：One of Point72 Asset Management’s star traders is leaving to launch his own hedge fund and has secured the largest initial backing the firm has ever granted to a departing trader.】

item.title: DraftKings 通过新交易应用程序进入预测市场热潮
item.description: DraftKings Inc. 将于周五发布一款新的应用程序，允许美国 38 个州的客户通过预测市场进行体育和金融活动的合约交易。【原文：DraftKings Inc. is releasing a new app on Friday that will allow customers in 38 states to trade contracts on sports and financial events through prediction markets.】

item.title: 数据中心停运 10 小时考验 KKR、GIP 的雄心壮志
item.description: 数据中心运营商对 "五个九 "的要求非常执着，希望他们能保证金融市场、电子商务和人工智能背后的基础设施在 99.999% 的时间内正常运行。【原文：Data center operators are fixated on the “five nines” — an expectation that they’ll keep the infrastructure behind financial markets, e-commerce and artificial intelligence running 99.999% of the time.】

item.title: 稳定币热潮助推全天候无国界美元银行业务
item.description: 三年前，穆斯塔法-伊斯梅尔在肯尼亚创办了 Karcsham Co.公司，为非洲和拉丁美洲十几个国家的数千名客户转售星联设备并管理订阅服务。起初，他用当地的银行卡支付每月账单。但是，5% 的外汇兑换费很快就蚕食了他的利润。【原文：Three years ago Mustafa Ismael launched Karcsham Co., a Kenya-based company that resells Starlink devices and manages subscriptions for thousands of customers across a dozen African and Latin American countries. At first he used his local bank card to pay the monthly bills. But the 5% foreign exchange fees soon began eating into his profits.】

item.title: 联合健康在外部顾问审查中发现合规漏洞
item.description: 联合健康集团公司（UnitedHealth Group Inc.【原文：UnitedHealth Group Inc. released the first outside reviews of its business practices — reports it commissioned that describe its policies as “robust” while pointing to ongoing problems in areas that have faced scrutiny.】

item.title: 欧洲受伤行业努力抓住经济尾风
item.description: 碳政策的调整和天然气价格的下降并不能解决该地区的竞争力问题。【原文：Carbon-policy tweaks and lower gas prices can’t solve the region’s competitiveness problem.】

item.title: 花旗集团创 2018 年以来最差回报，因天然气押注失利
item.description: 肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）的花旗集团（Citadel）有望创下 2018 年以来最差的年度回报率，因为此前作为对冲基金利润主要驱动力的天然气赌注已经失效。【原文：Ken Griffin’s Citadel is on track for its worst annual return since 2018 after wagers on natural gas — previously a major driver of the hedge fund’s profits — fizzled.】

item.title: 英国统计局研究强制调查作为可能的数据解决方案
item.description: 英国国家统计局正在为一项可能的法律修改做准备，该修改将迫使家庭对关键的经济调查做出回应，因为该局在数据质量崩溃后正试图重建其公信力。【原文：Britain’s Office for National Statistics is preparing for a potential change in the law that would force households to respond to key economic surveys, as it tries to rebuild its credibility after a collapse in data quality.】

item.title: 英国航空所有者在 TAP 少数股权上面临挑战
item.description: IAG SA 警告说，拥有 TAP SA 的少数股权将对英国航空公司的母公司构成挑战，该公司更希望拥有多数股权，以提高葡萄牙航空公司的利润率。【原文：IAG SA has warned that owning a minority stake in TAP SA will present a challenge for the British Airways parent, which would prefer majority ownership to lift the Portuguese airline’s margins.】

item.title: 欧洲不可或缺的芯片制造公司找到了自己的声音
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日通讯。今天，Peter Elstrom 撰写了他访问 ASML 首席执行官 Christophe Fouquet 的文章，探讨欧洲领先科技公司之一面临的全球性问题。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Peter Elstrom writes about his visit with ASML CEO Christophe Fouquet, addressing the global issues facing one of Europe’s leading tech companies.】

item.title: 全球利率政策周期正在失去动力
item.description: 欧洲及其他地区央行的决定凸显出货币政策行动的冲动正在减弱。【原文：Central bank decisions in Europe and beyond highlight a waning impulse for monetary policy action.】

item.title: 沃恩斯奇说：如果前景明朗，欧洲央行可继续按兵不动
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员皮埃尔-旺施（Pierre Wunsch）表示，如果其最新展望中的预测属实，欧洲中央银行可以在一段时间内保持借贷成本不变。【原文：The European Central Bank can leave borrowing costs untouched for some time if the predictions in its latest outlook pan out, according to Governing Council member Pierre Wunsch.】

item.title: Eminence Capital 要求 Graphic Packaging 聘回首席执行官
item.description: Graphic Packaging Holding Co.的一位大股东抨击该公司董事会解雇了首席执行官，并威胁说除非这一决定被推翻，否则他将发起一场 "公开运动"。【原文：A major Graphic Packaging Holding Co. shareholder is blasting the company’s board for firing its chief executive officer and threatening a “public campaign” unless that decision is reversed.】

item.title: 加拿大大力推动建筑业发展，卡特彼勒经销商业绩再创新高
item.description: 卡特彼勒公司（Caterpillar Inc.【原文：The Canadian dealer of Caterpillar Inc.’s massive earth movers and bulldozers is benefiting from a construction boom that’s powered its stock into an epic rally.】

item.title: Glencore 旗下 Kazzinc 据称将向竞争对手开放金属销售
item.description: 由嘉能可公司（Glencore Plc）控股的哈萨克斯坦矿业公司 Kazzinc Ltd. 将向竞争对手交易商开放金属销售，此举正值各国政府寻求从其自然资源中获得更多控制权和收入之际。【原文：Kazzinc Ltd., a Kazakh miner majority-owned by Glencore Plc, will open up its metal sales to rival traders, a move that comes as governments seek greater control and revenue from their natural resources.】

item.title: 扎克伯格与他创办的支持移民组织断绝关系
item.description: 马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）的慈善机构已经与他十多年前创立的支持移民的倡导组织断绝了关系，此举与他在唐纳德-特朗普总统连任后对公司政策和财务捐赠所做的其他大刀阔斧的改变如出一辙。【原文：Mark Zuckerberg’s philanthropy has cut ties with the pro-immigration advocacy group that he founded more than a decade ago, a move that parallels other sweeping changes he’s made to his company’s policies and his financial giving in the wake of President Donald Trump’s re-election.】

item.title: 多伦多经济繁荣后，"公寓衰退 "引发开发商震荡
item.description: 多伦多有大量未售出的公寓，但它们仍在不断涌现。【原文：Toronto is awash in unsold condos, but they just keep coming.】

item.title: 投资者对科技股徘徊于乐观与担忧之间
item.description:
云计算股票涨跌互现，软件困境成为 2025 年重大新闻之一。【原文：

Rise and fall of cloud computing stocks, software woes among big stories in 2025.

】

item.title: 新监察机构力图打破波兰预算无边无际的 "神话
item.description: 在波兰成为欧盟公共部门赤字规定的最大违反者之际，波兰新成立的财政委员会负责人希望为预算辩论注入更多现实元素。【原文：The head of Poland’s newly created Fiscal Council wants to inject more reality into the budget debate as the country becomes the biggest offender of European Union public-sector deficit rules.】

item.title: 2025 年美国人将面临严峻的就业市场，明年不会有喘息机会
item.description: 对于正在找工作的美国人来说，今年是艰难的一年。预测人员认为他们的前景在 2026 年不会有太大改善。【原文：This year was a difficult one for Americans looking for work. Forecasters don’t see much improvement in their prospects coming in 2026.】

item.title: IG 2017 年以来最好的一周，推动股价跻身英国蓝筹股行列
item.description: 对于英国交易平台 IG Group Plc 的投资者来说，本周是相当精彩的一周，股价飙升至新的高度，使该公司距离富时 100 指数近在咫尺。【原文：It’s been quite the week for investors in UK trading platform IG Group Plc as the shares soar to new heights, putting the company within touching distance of the FTSE 100 Index.】

item.title: Grab 收购中国公司 Infermove 以拓展人工智能机器人领域
item.description: Grab Holdings Ltd.收购了中国科技公司Infermove，以拓展人工智能机器人送餐业务。【原文：Grab Holdings Ltd. has acquired Chinese tech company Infermove to expand in artificial intelligence-enabled robotics for food delivery.】

item.title: 卡扎克说：欧洲央行需要充分的选择性，同时兼顾两方面的风险
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员马丁斯-卡扎克说，经济形势好于预期，但由于全球不确定性持续存在，官员们必须将所有可能性都摆在桌面上。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Martins Kazaks said the economy has been faring better than expected but officials must keep all possibilities on the table because of continued uncertainty globally.】

item.title: 法国将预算谈判推迟至 2026 年，引发赤字疑虑
item.description: 法国议会的一个委员会未能就 2026 年的预算案达成一致意见，这将有关全面财政计划的讨论推向了新的一年，也增加了人们对政府如何控制赤字的疑虑。【原文：A French parliamentary committee failed to agree on a 2026 budget, pushing discussion on the full fiscal plan into the new year and increasing doubts over how the government can rein in the deficit.】

item.title: 美国国债迎来 11 月以来首次周度上涨
item.description: 基准美国国债有望实现 11 月以来的首次单周上涨，此前意外降温的通胀数据和失业率的飙升巩固了美联储明年将至少降息两次的预期。【原文：Benchmark US Treasuries are on track for their first weekly gain since November after unexpectedly cool inflation numbers and a jump in the jobless rate cemented expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut rates at least twice next year.】

item.title: 俄罗斯在明年增税前选择适度下调关键利率
item.description: 俄罗斯连续第二次将基准利率下调了半个百分点，此举对企业几乎没有什么帮助，但却凸显了人们对即将到来的增税可能会刺激通货膨胀的担忧。【原文：Russia lowered its benchmark interest rate by half a percentage point for the second consecutive time, a move that will offer little relief to businesses but underscores concerns that an upcoming tax hike could stoke inflation.】

item.title: 在高盛和 Citadel 证券公司，圣诞老人反弹有了信仰者
item.description: 在 12 月份的大部分时间里，交易员们都在猜测典型的年末 "圣诞老人反弹 "是否会启动，现在他们可能终于等到了自己一直在等待的东西。【原文：Traders who spent most of December wondering if the typical year-end “Santa Claus rally” was ever going to kick in may finally be getting what they’ve been waiting for.】

item.title: 六张图表展示 2025 年股市如何重塑
item.description: 股票投资者不能说今年的市场缺乏戏剧性。【原文：Stock investors can’t claim that this year has lacked market drama.】

item.title: 德国联邦银行称 2026 年德国国内生产总值将 "显著增强
item.description: 德国联邦银行（Bundesbank）表示，在国防和基础设施公共支出增加的帮助下，德国经济将在明年逐步复苏，并在 2027 年获得增长势头。【原文：Germany’s economy will gradually recover next year and gain momentum in 2027, helped by higher public outlays on defense and infrastructure, the Bundesbank said.】

item.title: 泡沫和无聊的赌注：2026 年科技股将何去何从？
item.description: 在投资者的记忆中，2025 年是人工智能涨势扩大的一年，人们对人工智能的担忧也变得更加明显。【原文：Investors will remember 2025 as the year the artificial intelligence rally broadened out and the fears became more pronounced — not only of a bubble in the stocks, but also of the disruption the technology represents.】
